document.full_text: sticking power was what helped japan's capcom, best known for macho games like street fighter and resident evil, break out of its niche and score an international smartphone hit with the gentler smurfs' village, the company's president said in an interview.
document.title: capcom sticks to its guns in transition to smurfs
lines_and_colors: sticking power was what helped japan's capcom, best known for macho games like street fighter and resident evil, break out of its niche and score an international smartphone hit with the gentler smurfs' village, the company's president said in an interview.
